api_list.name: CountCompanies
api_list.description:
# Description GET Number Of Companies

This url is to get the number of Companies created is type `GET`, the url is `BASE_URL/companies/count` and returns the number of Companies.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://acopaer.p.rapidapi.com/companies/count"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "acopaer.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: UpdateCompanyBy:tax_number
api_list.description:
# Description PUT Company By tax_number

This url is to update a Company by tax_number is type `PUT`, the url is `BASE_URL/companies/tax_number` and returns empty and the code status 204.

The param is `tax_number` must type there the tax_number of Company to indicate the element to update.

Inside of body must have an object with the properties:

1 `tradename`

2 `business_name`

3 `tax_number`

4 `url`

5 `state`

6 `city`

7 `phone`

8 `address`

9 `size`

10 `email`

11 `public`

12 `delete` is optional

13 `metadata` is optional but if it send must be an object
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://acopaer.p.rapidapi.com/companies/{tax_number}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "acopaer.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.put(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: DeleteCompanyBy:tax_number
api_list.description:
# Description DELETE Company By tax_number

This url is to delete a Company by tax_number is type `DELETE`, the url is `BASE_URL/companies/tax_number` and returns the object deleted.

The query param is `?hard=true` if you send it so, will delete it forever but if you don't send it or you sent like this `?hard=false` it just will update the field `delete` to false of that company

The param is `tax_number` must type there the tax_number of the Company to can delete it.

6 `embed_html`

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://acopaer.p.rapidapi.com/answers-forms/{id}"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "acopaer.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.put(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: DisableForm
api_list.description:
# Description POST Disable Form
This url is to disable a Form by id is type `POST`, the url is `BASE_URL/forms/id/disable` and returns empty and the code status 204.

The param is `id` must type there the id of Form to get details about this Form.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://acopaer.p.rapidapi.com/forms/5f6174f470cbd2003aca975f/disable"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "acopaer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: CreateForms
api_list.description:
# Description POST Forms
This url is to create a Forms is type `POST`, the url is `BASE_URL/forms` and returns the id of the object created.

Inside of body must have an object with the properties:

1 `url`

2 `version`

3 `name`

4 `fields`

5 `embed_html`
api_list.code:

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "acopaer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: CreateCompany
api_list.description:
# Description POST Company

This url is to create a Company is type `POST`, the url is `BASE_URL/companies` and returns the id of the object created.

Inside of body must have an object with the properties:

1 `tradename`

2 `business_name`

3 `tax_number`

4 `url`

5 `state`

6 `city`

7 `phone`

8 `address`

9 `size`

10 `email`

11 `user`

12 `public`

13 `documents` is optional

14 `delete` is optional

15 `metadata` is optional but if it send must be an object
api_list.code:

url = "https://acopaer.p.rapidapi.com/companies/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "acopaer.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: CreateScenario
api_list.description:
# Description POST Scenario
This url provides a Scenario, method type `POST`.

`BASE_URL/scenarios`

returns the object created.

### Body

```
{
    "name": "test",
    "code": "test"
}
```

api_list.name: EnableForm
api_list.description:
# Description POST Enable Form
This url is to Enable a Form by id is type `POST`, the url is `BASE_URL/forms/id/enable` and returns empty and the code status 204.

The param is `id` must type there the id of Form to get details about this Form.

Inside of body must have an object with the properties:

1 `name`
